definition: an expedition, esp. military/march to remote regions
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack
expeditionary force/army on a distant expedition

sentences.english: A lot of expeditions stock up on that before they go.
sentences.chinese: 不少遠征團出發前，都備好大量肯達爾薄荷餅。

sentences.english: In 1768 his big chance for a major expedition came.
sentences.chinese: 1768年，他最大的運氣就是主要的遠征回來了。

sentences.english: See also Lewis and Clark Expedition.
sentences.chinese: 又見劉易斯和克拉克遠征。

sentences.english: A trip to Dubai at the end of March has long been in Allen's planning for Fairy King Prawn.
sentences.chinese: 愛倫早就計劃讓靚蝦王在三月尾遠征杜拜。

sentences.english: The ref FSV mainz give all brings the serious influence.
sentences.chinese: 遠征軍的大潰敗給一切人都帶來嚴重影響。

sentences.english: Qin aggrandizement was aided by frequent military expeditions pushing forward the frontiers in the north and south.
sentences.chinese: 秦擴張是藉助頻繁的軍事遠征推進邊界北部和南部。

sentences.english: Our mission is to harass the landing of the main japanese expeditionary force .
sentences.chinese: 我們的任務是騷亂日本遠征軍主力的登陸。

sentences.english: Others were gathering a second expedition to the tide pools.
sentences.chinese: 另一些人聚攏在一起，準備再來一次潮汐池遠征。

sentences.english: Cao expedites the forecast obtains the auspicious silver China chief economist Wang Tao's approval.
sentences.chinese: 曹遠征的預測得到瑞銀中國首席經濟學家汪濤的認同。

sentences.english: When he was sixteen, he lied about his age to participate in the expedition.
sentences.chinese: 16歲時，他謊報年齡參加了遠征軍。

sentences.english: In The Burning Crusade. this translates into a divided Silvermoon.
sentences.chinese: 在燃燒遠征中，這被演繹成被一分爲二的銀月城。

sentences.english: On the other hand, a European expedition would serve mainly Batu’s private interests.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，遠征歐洲主要可滿足拔都的個人利益。

sentences.english: It has inspired countless expeditions to Mount Ararat in search of the ark.
sentences.chinese: 它鼓舞了無數的遠征在亞拉臘山尋找方舟。

sentences.english: No one in the expedition was fully fluent in the Icelandic language.
sentences.chinese: 遠征隊軍中沒有一個人會說流利的冰島語。

sentences.english: They equipped themselves for the expedition.
He confuses the two, mixing up details about the first expedition with those of the second.
sentences.chinese: 他將忽必烈第一次和第二次遠征的細節弄混了。

definition: lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
to go to war/to engage in war
